com.ihealth.communication.control

Class Po3Control

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ihealth.communication.control.Po3Control
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DeviceControl

    public class Po3Control
extends java.lang.Object
implements DeviceControl
    Public API for the PO3

    The class provides methods to control PO3 device. You need to call the device method, and then call the connection method

    If you want to connect a PO3 device, you need to call iHealthDevicesManager.startDiscovery(long) to discovery a new PO3 device, and then call iHealthDevicesManager.connectDevice(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)to connect PO3 device.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Po3Control

        public Po3Control(java.lang.String username,
                  android.content.Context context,
                  java.lang.String accessoryFirm,
                  com.ihealth.communication.base.comm.BaseComm mBaseComm,
                  java.lang.String mac,
                  java.lang.String type,
                  com.ihealth.communication.base.comm.BaseCommCallback baseCommCallback,
                  com.ihealth.communication.ins.InsCallback insCallback)
        A construct of Po3Control
        Parameters:
        username - the identification of the user, could be the form of email address or mobile phone.
        context - Context.
        accessoryFirm - Accessory Firmware Version, get from IDPS.
        mBaseComm - class for communication.
        mac - valid Ble address(without colon).
        type - valid Ble type.
        baseCommCallback - communication callback.
        insCallback - Po3 device callback.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes method
        • Used to send random group of R1, identify the connection device.
        • Attention, this method calls after creating the Po3Control object.
        • In iHealthDevicesManager.identify(String, String) method is invoked for the first time.
        Specified by:
        init in interface DeviceControl

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnect the PO3

        When the APP exit or need to disconnect, call the method

        Specified by:
        disconnect in interface DeviceControl

      • getBattery

        public void getBattery()
        Get the PO3 battery status
        • This is an asynchronous call, it will not return immediately.
        • After getting the activity data, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be ACTION_BATTERY_PO
          • The keys of message will show in the KeyList of the action.
        • Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
          iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)

      • startMeasure

        public void startMeasure()
        Start real-time measurement
        • This is an asynchronous call, it will not return immediately.
        • After getting the activity data, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be ACTION_LIVEDA_PO and ACTION_RESULTDATA_PO
          • The keys of message will show in the KeyList of the live action and KeyList of the result action.
        • Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
          iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)

      • getHistoryData

        public void getHistoryData()
        Get the value of historical data in the PO3
        • This is an asynchronous call, it will not return immediately.
        • After getting the activity data, following callback will be triggered:
          iHealthDevicesCallback.onDeviceNotify(String mac, String deviceType, String action, String message)
          • The action will be ACTION_OFFLINEDATA_PO and ACTION_NO_OFFLINEDATA_PO
          • The keys of message will show in the KeyList of the action and KeyList of the no result action.
        • Attention, it is mandatory to call following method before you call this method:
          iHealthDevicesManager.registerClientCallback(iHealthDevicesCallback)

      • getUpDeviceControl

        public UpDeviceControl getUpDeviceControl()
        Get UpDeviceControl's implementation.
        We recommend not use this method, use iHealthDevicesUpgradeManager instead.
        Returns:
        UpDeviceControl's implementation
        See Also:
        iHealthDevicesUpgradeManager

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Specified by:
        destroy in interface DeviceControl
